ALLEGED.Definition: said, without proof, to have done it

CRICKETS.Definition: a type of insects (used as an expression meaning 'complete silence')

LEADS.Definition: information that could help with the investigation

ELITE.Definition: the richest and most powerful group in the society

RAIDED.Definition: made a surprise sudden search or visit

WAREHOUSE.Definition: a large building for storing things

SHED.Definition: a small building for storing things

HITMEN.Definition: men who were paid to kill

FIXERS.Definition: people who made arrangements for illegal activities

MERCENARIES.Definition: people who were paid to do it

CIGARETTE BUTTS.Definition: the parts of cigarettes that are left when someone has finished smoking them

CYNICAL.Definition: expressing a doubting or questioning attitude

LIFELONG.Definition: having been criminals for their whole life

TRACKED DOWN.Definition: found them after looking for them

GET THEIR STORY STRAIGHT.Definition: agree on their account of what happened

UNDER THE COVER OF DARKNESS.Definition: hidden by the darkness of night

CYANIDE.Definition: a powerful poison that can kill people

PRAM.Definition: a four-wheeled carriage for a baby

INNER CIRCLE.Definition: small group of people with a lot of power and influence

PATHETIC FALLACY.Definition: a feeling of mystery or a warning caused by a random event

PARDONED.Definition: not given any punishment at all

DAMNING.Definition: suggesting very strongly that he was guilty

ALLIES.Definition: people who were helping and supporting him

RECUSED.Definition: he removed himself from the decision

CABINET.Definition: body or group of high-ranking state officials

ALLEGATION.Definition: statement, made without proof, that he was guilty

RIGHT HAND MAN.Definition: his most helpful and important supporter

MASTERMIND.Definition: the person who had planned and organised it

ALLEGATIONS.Definition: statements, made without proof, that he was guilty of a crime

SCANDALS.Definition: events who caused public shock and anger
